roleset.name: (cause to) be confused

role.descr: confused about or over what? (first or all things)
second thing, confused arg2 with what

example.name: transitive
example.text: Temple, however, harshly criticized Sea Containers' plan yesterday, characterizing it as [a ``highly conditional device]-1 designed *trace*-1 to entrench management, confuse shareholders and prevent them from accepting our superior cash offer.''

example.name: one thing confused
example.text: He believes that the volatile conditions created by program trading has ``thoroughly confused'' investors about where the market is headed.
example.arg: the volatile conditions created by program trading
about where the market is headed

example.name: two things confused
example.text: I think the reason is that you are confusing tax ``rates'' with tax ``payments.''

roleset.note: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls amalgamate-22.2-2, amuse-31.1.
